Articles.Content:
I always wanted to get KSP since I've heard and read so many good things about it, but since I purchased the Apple version KSP via Steam for my iMAC, I've tried many times to play KSP but even after several re-installs it keeps on hanging up and crashing after the initial load (I do see the "Monkey General" Logo and all the files being loaded) and after I get to the Main Menu I select START NEW GAME and TRAINING (any tutorial within TRAINING) and/or START GAME from the menu provided.  Once I select either, I get a cursor arrow which changes into a spinning colored wheel on a black screen with only the "LOADING" icon in the lower right hand corner.  Nothing else happens and I wind up "Force Quitting" the game.  

Can someone out there give me some advice/instructions on what I need to do to get KSP to work?  I am very frustrated and disappointed with the current status of KSP on my iMAC.

Have you tried starting the game with the 32bit binary instead of the 64bit binary?

Also, please check out this thread:

 

Edited April 22, 2016 by h4didact

On OSX it's a unified binary, there's no separate 32bit and 64bit versions.

We'll need more info to even begin to diagnose this, please see this thread.

We'll need the game logs and the system specs/model of your Mac.
